AD_BeckonPlayer.synopsis: An amulet calls out to the player amid the rocks surrounded by lava in Grymforge.

EquipAmulet.synopsis: When the player picks up the Monk's Amulet the monk's astral self appears and will start talking with the player. The player can find out who the monk is, what the amulet does. Later, they find that wearing the amulet will slowly drive them mad as they wear it (the monk has no control over this).
EquipAmulet.how_to_trigger: Pick up or equip S_UND_MonkAmulet_Amulet_de2ea5a9-943a-4794-9ef7-208be7747178To trigger GREETING1. Enter the game as any character and 'loadlevel WLD_Main_A' into recon.2. goto -626.25, -4.53, 223.75.3. create OBJ_Scroll_Knock 10 and cast knock on the locked chest.4. Equip the amulet

AD_FailedWisdomSave.synopsis: After resting and leaving camp, the haunted amulet curses the player with periodic fits of laughter if they use the amulet's ability  if they do not pass a wisdom save. Amulet speaks this dialogue. Shar-allied clerics and paladins get different lines: the amulet is happy to drive them mad.

ResistMadness.synopsis: Player has left the camp. A few moments later, they are overcome with an unnatural sense of cheer. If they fail the check, they will fall over in laughter every time they use the amulet's special power that day.The madness has several levels.
ResistMadness.how_to_trigger: Leave camp or equip the amulet after using successfully using the amulet's unique ability multiple times during the previous dayRepro steps to get the amulet:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -626 2244. Unlock the Adamantine chest5. Take the amulet.Repro steps:1. Get the amulet2. Use the ability multiple times.3. Go to Camp.4. Fully rest and leave camp.5. Equip or stow amulet.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Looking at the content and trigger conditions for the sessions, we see that the amulet first 'calls' the player in the AD_BeckonPlayer session. This suggests that before any interaction with the amulet (EquipAmulet) occurs, the player is lured or prompted by AD_BeckonPlayer. Next, the EquipAmulet session is triggered when the player picks up or equips the Monk's Amulet. Both AD_FailedWisdomSave and ResistMadness result from consequences of having equipped and used the amulet – they activate after leaving camp and after certain actions (resting, using the ability multiple times). In logical narrative flow, the EquipAmulet session must occur before either of the madness-related sessions. Finally, because AD_FailedWisdomSave is described as the dialogue when the player fails the wisdom save after resting (with the curse emerging) and ResistMadness is described in connection with failing a check after repeated use of the amulet’s ability, they represent alternative outcomes of the amulet’s corrupting influence. As a result, they are mutually exclusive within a single playthrough (i.e. the player will experience one branch based on different conditions).

AD_BeckonPlayer_0.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
AD_BeckonPlayer_0.text: To me! I shall guide thee.

EquipAmulet_57.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_57.text: Thou shalt return me, ho HO. Thou shalt have my blessing.

EquipAmulet_82.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_82.text: Thou hast come. Hee. Hee. Hee-HEE!

EquipAmulet_81.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_81.text: *The amulet is heavy, but holds a subtle warmth, like it was left under the sun.*

EquipAmulet_77.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_77.text: *Suddenly, the metal surges with heat. You feel great power and an overwhelming urge - to laugh.*

EquipAmulet_26.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_26.text: *Flying machines. Walking brains. It's all so absurd!*

EquipAmulet_7.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_7.text: What is happening? What are you doing to me?

EquipAmulet_34.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_34.text: *The urge to laugh intensifies. Talking jewellery? That's hilarious!*

EquipAmulet_27.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_27.text: Do not abandon my blessing - hee hee!

EquipAmulet_21.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_21.text: *You stifle a chuckle and drop the amulet. The urge to laugh passes...*
EquipAmulet_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stifles their laughter and drops the amulet. The spirit disappears.InternalNodeContext: Player takes 1 fire damage.

EquipAmulet_1.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_1.text: *The laugh-urge fades. A quiet power spreads from hand to head, then down to your feet.*

EquipAmulet_108.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_108.text: *There is no escaping the laughter. Telepathic mushrooms? Walking brains? It's all so comical!*

EquipAmulet_76.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_76.text: Ha. Ha ha. Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha hee!
EquipAmulet_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player breaks out in uncontrollable laughter as Tasha's Hideous Laughter is cast on them. Eventually, it dissipates, leaving the player briefly clutching their stomach in pain before returning to their default state.NodeContext: Uncontrollable laughter, on the brink of madness.

EquipAmulet_68.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_68.text: How unfortunate. Alas, thou must do. Hee. Hee. Hee hee hee hee hee hee!

EquipAmulet_90.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_90.text: Squash all cheer and summon memories of your ancestral enemy - the mind flayers.

EquipAmulet_44.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_44.text: *Images of illithids torturing and tormenting your people quells the urge to laugh - for now.*

EquipAmulet_20.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_20.text: Quiet your mind. Let everything be still.

EquipAmulet_38.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_38.text: *You observe the urge to laugh from afar, letting it fade with each breath.*

EquipAmulet_47.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_47.text: *Sheer, unbridled rage floods your veins, obliterating the urge to laugh.*

EquipAmulet_105.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_105.text: Whisper a prayer. Quell the feeling with your devotion.

EquipAmulet_75.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_75.text: Summon your light and devotion as you push back.

EquipAmulet_112.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_112.text: *Your faith and dedication surrounds you, forming an impenetrable shield.*

EquipAmulet_64.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_64.text: Grit your teeth. Summon your god's wrath.

EquipAmulet_33.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_33.text: *You know a fury more beautiful, more devastating than any. It wraps you in a comforting embrace.*

EquipAmulet_63.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_63.text: Thou hast done well. For what is a laugh, if not one step toward madness?

EquipAmulet_91.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_91.text: Hee. Hee. Hee hee hee hee hee hee. Thou art the one!

EquipAmulet_111.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_111.text: Return me, take me home - and thou shalt glow with blessings!

EquipAmulet_16.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_16.text: To my granddaughter. Shirra Clarwen. Serves Ilmater, she doth.

EquipAmulet_107.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_107.text: She waits in Wyrm's Crossing. Take me there, and thou shalt bathe in her golden gifts.

EquipAmulet_53.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_53.text: O! Thou shalt be blessed indeed. He he hee!

EquipAmulet_29.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_29.text: Are you a ghost? What happened to you?

EquipAmulet_84.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_84.text: A ghost? Ha HA! I am sunlight on water, dew on grass.

EquipAmulet_40.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_40.text: Sharrans broke my body. But my spirit, they could not. Well - not completely. Hee HEE!

EquipAmulet_94.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_94.text: Thou shalt return me home. It is written!

EquipAmulet_42.speaker: Shadowheart
EquipAmulet_42.text: That thing's tainted. Better to leave it than bear a dead man's grudges.

EquipAmulet_92.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_92.text: That laughter. What did you do to me?

EquipAmulet_51.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_51.text: I could barely hold my laughter. What did you do to me?

EquipAmulet_37.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_37.text: The Sharrans tormented me. And I laughed at the pain 'til ne'er couldst I stop.

EquipAmulet_74.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_74.text: Is there affliction more terrible than eternal joy? This is my pleasure. This is my curse.

EquipAmulet_3.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_3.text: Ha. Haha. Ha ha ha HA HA HA HAAAAAA!

EquipAmulet_54.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_54.text: I will take you to your granddaughter at Wyrm's Crossing.

EquipAmulet_96.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_96.text: I shall walk with thee. I shall grant you my power. He HEE.

EquipAmulet_4.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_4.text: I've found Wyrm's Crossing. Where is your granddaughter?

EquipAmulet_104.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_104.text: Shirra hath devoted her body and soul to Ilmater. Find her at the Open Hand Temple!

EquipAmulet_88.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_88.text: I'm afraid your granddaughter has passed away.

EquipAmulet_12.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_12.text: Oh ho ho HO NO NO!

EquipAmulet_109.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_109.text: This cannot, must not, shall not be - he HEE. You must open her tomb in the Open Hand Temple, posthaste. She may bless us, even beyond the veil!

EquipAmulet_59.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_59.text: Done, it shalt be! Ho HO!

EquipAmulet_60.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_60.text: *You feel a chuckle coming on - but it soon fades.*
EquipAmulet_60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spirit fades away, player pockets amulet.

EquipAmulet_78.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_78.text: *Etched on its face is an image of the dawning sun.*

EquipAmulet_49.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_49.text: *Lines and arcs are etched into the metal, but you see no pattern in them.*

EquipAmulet_87.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_87.text: Contemplate the symbol of Lathander in your hand.

EquipAmulet_14.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_14.text: Contemplate the symbol of Lathander in your hand.

EquipAmulet_61.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_61.text: Consider the inscribed image. What could it mean?

EquipAmulet_100.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_100.text: *You recognise the symbol: it belongs to those sworn to Lathander, god of dawn and renewal.*

EquipAmulet_18.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_18.text: *Whatever madness this spirit suffers was inflicted by Lathander's enemies - followers of Shar. And this madness may flow into you.*

EquipAmulet_83.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_83.text: *The image is striking, but you find no meaning in it.*

EquipAmulet_9.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_9.text: Focus on this entity. What are its intentions?

EquipAmulet_48.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_48.text: *Beneath the rampant joy, you sense the monk's fear and sincerity. He doesn't wish to harm you - but that doesn't mean he won't.*

EquipAmulet_106.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_106.text: Prithee, now is not the time for dreaming! Open thine eyes, fair fool!

EquipAmulet_10.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_10.text: Close your eyes and let your magic flow through you in all its wild and beautiful glory.

EquipAmulet_118.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_118.text: *Your pure, raw power rips through the urge to laugh.*

EquipAmulet_52.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_52.text: Call on the power of your pact and resist the urge.

EquipAmulet_45.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_45.text: *Your power spikes, banishing the urge to laugh in an instant.*

EquipAmulet_58.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet_58.text: Reach for the Weave. Let it shield you from this impulse.

EquipAmulet_41.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_41.text: *The urge flows into the strands of the Weave, leaving only a sense of calm.*

EquipAmulet_95.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
EquipAmulet_95.text: Ha ha, hast thou missed me? Take me to my dear Shirra and open her tomb!

EquipAmulet_89.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet_89.text: *Laughter builds, deep in your chest. It is... irresistible.*

AD_FailedWisdomSave_0.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
AD_FailedWisdomSave_0.text: Would that I might ease thy madness.

AD_FailedWisdomSave_1.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
AD_FailedWisdomSave_1.text: I cannot stop it, sad to say. Oh ho!

AD_FailedWisdomSave_2.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
AD_FailedWisdomSave_2.text: Again? Ho ho. Such a wretched affliction.

AD_FailedWisdomSave_4.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
AD_FailedWisdomSave_4.text: He he HEE - poorest dear. If I could help, I would.

AD_FailedWisdomSave_3.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
AD_FailedWisdomSave_3.text: A burden, mine blessing can also be. So sorry. Ho ho HO!

AD_FailedWisdomSave_6.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
AD_FailedWisdomSave_6.text: The madness grows. I should have foreseen.

ResistMadness_10.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_10.text: *You suddenly feel cheerful. Too cheerful - as if even the grimmest sight might make you laugh.*

ResistMadness_34.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
ResistMadness_34.text: Hehee - not all is well with thee. Such is the price of mine favours!

ResistMadness_8.speaker: Player
ResistMadness_8.text: Think dark thoughts. Suppress the cheer.

ResistMadness_11.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_11.text: *The moment is over. The awful, horrible joy has passed.*

ResistMadness_22.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_22.text: *You are taken by an unnatural, unbidden bliss. You could fall down laughing at any moment.*

ResistMadness_49.speaker: Player
ResistMadness_49.text: Let the cheer flow through you.

ResistMadness_5.speaker: Player
ResistMadness_5.text: What's happening? What are you doing to me?

ResistMadness_13.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
ResistMadness_13.text: Ha ha! This is the madness the Sharrans wrought. Whilst thou wearest me, so sharest thou my curse.

ResistMadness_14.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_14.text: *You are overcome by irrational cheer, bordering on madness.*

ResistMadness_39.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
ResistMadness_39.text: The madness worsens. Thou must resist. Ha ha HO!

ResistMadness_47.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_47.text: *The maddening cheer withers away, leaving you breathless.*

ResistMadness_16.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_16.text: *You are rotted with joy; you are sick with pleasure. This is not happiness - it's an illusion.*

ResistMadness_33.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_33.text: *A giggle almost erupts from your throat. This moment strikes you as terribly funny.*

ResistMadness_3.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
ResistMadness_3.text: Mine curse hast become thine. Hehe hehee - alack!

ResistMadness_41.speaker: Player
ResistMadness_41.text: Stifle the strange sense of glee.

ResistMadness_24.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_24.text: *The joy fades as quickly as it came.*

ResistMadness_2.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_2.text: *Such unbearable happiness. Laughter bubbles within you, eager to escape.*

ResistMadness_46.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_46.text: *Your spirits are sky-high, and your steps unreasonably light.*

ResistMadness_26.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
ResistMadness_26.text: The agony of ecstasy - ha ha HEE! Why must pleasure bring such pain?

ResistMadness_4.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_4.text: *Your mood levels out. You have found balance.*

ResistMadness_7.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_7.text: *A smile reaches your lips, then melts away. A full laugh could be next.*

ResistMadness_50.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_50.text: *You feel a joy so sudden, so intense, that you nearly collapse from the force of it.*

ResistMadness_27.speaker: GROUP_GLO_MonkAmulet_Spirit
ResistMadness_27.text: The madness worsens. Thou must resist. Ha ha HO!

ResistMadness_21.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_21.text: *The maddening cheer withers away, leaving you breathless.*

ResistMadness_48.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness_48.text: *You are rotted with joy, sick with pleasure. This isn't true happiness - it's an illusion.*
